712308f-a.text:
36th Street, north side, west from and including Second Avenue.
March 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

712299f-a.text:
301 to 337 East 36th Street (foreground), north side, east from Second (left), to but not including First Aves., showing (left to right) the 4atory St. Gabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library (No. 303-305); the Hall of St. Gabriel's (R.C.) Church (No. 307-309); and St. Gabriel's Parochial School (No. 311-321). Also shown is a general view northward from 317-323 East 34th Street, a 12-story loft building, with the News Building (under construction ) on the south side of E. 42nd Street, between Second and Third Avenues, and several units of Tudor City across the background.
September 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr. '

707842f-a.text:
Second Ave., east side, north from East 36th Street. Note the Second
Ave. Elevated line overhead.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707848f-c.text:
Second Avenue, at the S.W. corner of East 37th Street, showing the preparatory work on the future site of the entrance to the Midtown-Queen tunnel. Buildings occupying this, are being demolished. In the distance is the towering Empire State Building.
May W7, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Snerr

712297f-a.text:
(1)
St. Gabriel's Hall, 307 East 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, with part of the park in the foreground. This building is sandwiched between the St.Gabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library, at the left,and the parochial
school, at the right.
March 23, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, three years later, showing children, and mothers with
baby carriages, in the park..
April 6, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No's 1 and 2, and showing also a further view eastward so as to include the parochial school.
October 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

March 27, 1938.
P. L. Sperr,

707835f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, north from E. 36th Street. Note the hazy outline of the News Building over center roof
top.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York Sity Tunnel Authority

707839f-b.text:
Second Avenue, west side, north from East 36th Street. At 37th Street is a vacant lot at the S.W. corner.  This will be excavated for the entrance to the Midtown Queens
Tunnel.
Across the roof of the 4 story building at the N.W. corner appears the utilitarian News Building. Note
that these Views are one month apart.
View 1: May 26, 1939
View 2: June 28, 1939
View 3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707840f-c.text:
Second Avenue, east side, North from East 36th Street, showing the cleared area extending to 37th Street. This is to be excavated for the approach to the new Midtown Queens Tunnel.
Note the clearance at the far corner of 37th Street which opens to view the rears of tenenents that face on 38th Strect. The 1d story apartment house, No. 3O1 East, is at the H.E. corner of this thoroughfare. To the right is the darkened side of the New York Public Library branch. This
will be demolished in early 1940.
View 1: June 28, 1939
Views 2-3: July 23, 1939
P. L. Sperr

707840f-a.text:
Second Avenue, east side, North from East 36th Street, showing the cleared area extending to 37th Street. This is to be excavated for the approach to the new Midtown Queens Tunnel.

707841f-b.text:
Second Avenue, north from East 36th Street, showing mainly the east side of this thoroughfare. In the foreground, and extending to 37th Street is a fenced clearance necessitated by the Miidtown-Queens Tunnel plaza approach. The remaining structure is the St. Gabriels branch of the New York Public Library. This
is to come down early in 194O.
In the distance appears Tudor City. The apartment structure on the Avenue, is at the N .E. corner of 3B8th Street. This bears No. 30l East 38th Street and was
constructed in 1930.
May 26, 1939
Views: 1-2-3
P. L. Sperr

707843f-a.text:
Second Avenue, east side, north from E. 36th Street, showing in the foreground a row of buildings, prior to demolition (June) for the Queens Midtown Tunnel. These bear No's. 664 to 682 inclusive. Note just beyond the last enumerated structure a similar clearance at the N . E. corner of 37th Street. The apartment house seen is No. 3Ol E. 38th Street and is at the N. E. corner there.
January B, 1939
Somiach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

707844f-a.text:
Second Avenue, west side, south from E. 37th to 36th Streets. These buildings shown,will be demolished for tunnel construction. In June of this year the only ones standing will
be the three at the far corner.
January 8, 1939
Somach Photo Bervice
New York City Tunnel Authority

712301f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, showing St. Gabriel's Hall prior to demolition. This is sandwiched in between the branch of the New York Public Library left) and St. Gabriel's Parochial School (right). The church is to the rear of the latter and faces on the south side of
E. 37th Street. (W.v.)
January 12, 1939
Somach Photo Service
New York City Tunnel Authority

712305f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, east from Second Avenue, showing mainly the northwesterly corner of St. Gabriel's Park, viewed southwestward. Across same appears the New York Steam Co. plant (First Avenue) and buildings on the south side of E. 35th Street. To the left is St. Gabriel's parochial School and a row of tenements, all of which are to be demolished for the 38th Street tunnel approach.
January 8, 1939
Sorach Photo 9ervice
New York City Tunnel Authnority

712306f-a.text:
E.36th Street, west of Second Avenue, emphasising mainly the south side of this thoroughfare. Across the rooftops of same is the tower of the Empire State Building.

712312f-a.text:
E. 36th Street, north side, west from Second to Third Avenues. The B. Altman (department store) warehouse and garage is

view 1: East 36th Street, e. fr. Second Avenue, showing change in road level because of construction of

St. Gabriels Hall, w/ Eact 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue, with part of the park in the foreground. Ihis building is sandwiched between the St. Sabriel's Park branch of the New York Public Library (at the left) and the parochial school (at the right).

712303f-b.text:
East 36th Street, north side, east of Second Avenue (foreground), showing demolition for the pla2a
approach to the Midtown Gueens tunnel.
Standing intact in all views is the St. Gabriel's branch of the New York Public Library. This is the last of the builonga re.aining on the "plaza" and it too will be
razed in early 1940.
Adjoining same and partially destroyed in the early views are St. Gabriel's HLall and Parochial School. To the extreme right appear buiidings on the east side of First Avenue, between 36th and 37th Streets.
Views 1-2 May 26, 1939
View 3 June 28, 1939
P. L. Sperr
